headline: Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore
description: Prepared spaghetti sauce makes preparing this favorite Italian standby a breeze. Just add chicken, mushrooms, onion, and green pepper and you are on your way! Serve over angel hair pasta.

video.description: Favorite Italian chicken dish prepared in a slow cooker.
video.name: Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore
recipeIngredient: 2 green bell pepper, seeded and cubed

recipeInstructions.text: Put the chicken in the slow cooker. Top with the spaghetti sauce, green bell peppers, mushrooms, onion, and garlic.
Cover, and cook on Low for 7 to 9 hours.

review.reviewBody: I made it in a smaller portion, used only 1 large Chicken breast, and added carrots and celery since I didn't have any green bell pepper. I also added 1/2 c. fresh parsley. It's in the slow cooker now! Can't wait to try it. I did add a pinch of Cayenne pepper too.

4 stars for ingredients other than chicken. Need bones for flavor, would include some thigh and leg meat. Also skin adds flavor and requires some amount of browning first; might only add 5-10 minutes to prep time.
Mine turned out so garlicky, but, delicious ðŸ˜‹

This recipe was a HUGE hit for this family of five. I combined the original recipe as well as a few suggestions from some of the reviews. I put 4 fresh boneless, skinless chicken breasts in the crockpot. Added 1/2-2/3 jar of Rao's Marinara spaghetti sauce, 1 can diced tomatoes, 1 can tomato paste, 6 oz of red wine (small bottle of a Cabernet Sauvignon), diced onion (1/2-3/4), diced pepper (1-1.5 green), 2-3 teaspoons of minced garlic, sprinkled in oregano, onion powder, and basil. Mixed well and covered the chicken with the sauce. Cooked on low for 4-5 hrs. Around the 4 hour mark, I took the chicken out and cut into sections before placing back into the sauce in the crockpot for the remainder of the time. Placed on top of linguini that'd already been plated and it was delicious!!! Kids were asking me to make it again before they'd even finished their dinner.
Great I added diced tomatoes and tomato sauce in place of spaghetti sauce. Added a little burgundy fresh basil and itialian herbs. Also added celery and a little carrot. perfect.
It tasted great but there has to be a way to keep the spaghetti sauce from getting so diluted

I thought the sauce was way too watery. Also, I checked it and with my slow cooker set on low, it was almost too done at 5-1/2 hours (175Â°) which is "done" but it continues to cook because the sauce is so hot. If I make this again I will make my own marinara sauce and use a little bit more of it than the recipe called for. I will also check it after 4-1/2 hours and until it is at 165Â°, then turn it off.

I cooked in a slow oven, instead. Used chicken breasts and thighs. I added a can of tomato paste, as others have suggested, and highly recommend that. Also added 1/3 cup of white wine. It was delicious!
Even the toughest critic love this. I played with spices and veggies but the base recipie is great!
Really enjoyed this and will make it again!

It was fine, but this is such a bare-bones "recipe" that I would barely call it a recipe. It's just the basic building blocks of chicken cacciatore, but no spices or anything. I added some spices and still found it pretty bland, but it wasn't terrible or anything.
I added basil, and an extra clove of garlic
Good recipe, my wife and I enjoyed it. Served it with rotini. Next time I may cut the onions and peppers in small strips versus dicing. I did add 1/2 of a red bell pepper for color.
So good and so easy!!!! I added red pepper flakes to kick it up a bit.

Followed the directions, but the flavor of the dish was overwhelmed by the green bell pepper. I prefer red, yellow or orange bell peppers and should have substituted. I can't say I'll ever make this recipe again.
Used chicken thighs and Rao's Marinara. Added sliced black olives, and a few more seasonings. Delish!
I have made it many times, changing things up now and then. Great recipe
It is like mom's
Excellent. Add 6 Oz can of tomato paste.
Loved it, second time making it. Simple and delicious highly recommend.
Super easy, I used a combination of boneless chicken breasts and thighs seasoned with salt, pepper, and Italian seasonings. Very flavorful.
Instead of Ragu I used Italian style small diced tomatoes and added green olives, black olives as well as green peppers it is absolutely delicious

We thought the flavor was good. The chicken was tender and shredded when cut. The sauce was thick. The only thing I would change would be to add another jar of spaghetti sauce. There wasn't enough sauce in our opinion. Adding another jar of sauce would make the final sauce thinner.
Served it to my family and guests and everyone raves about it.
I have made this more than once. A good quality spaghetti sauce makes a huge difference. I used Rao sauce the last two times and it definitely makes a difference in the taste!

So delicious! Instead of my trusty slow cooker, I used a Dutch oven. Chicken was tender as were the veggies! I served with angel hair pasta, along with some Italian crusty bread.Will definitely make again.
Super quick and easy!

It seemed like a fairly good recipe we had trouble. We halved the recipe and still had a ton of left overs. The serving size is not correct at all. Furthermore, it was runny and very bland. It was edible but wholly not that appetizing. We tried to doctor it up with some sweet hot sauce but even that couldn't save it.
Made it twice using two different spaghetti sauces. Both were very runny. Will not make again.
This recipe does not have a lot of flavor. If I make it again, I will add more Italian spices.
It did not have much flavor and was very soupy.

So not nearly as spicy as I like, rather bland tasting. After doing the taste nest, the next day I added more seed in Jalapeno, Cajun seasoning and chile pepper and reheated for an hour or so. Now a nice little tang. I added some spinach separately in a serving to experiment and that was a nice touch as well.
Great but better with just tomato sauce rather than spaghetti bolognese sauce
So easy and delicious
I didn't add the mushroom, but it taste so good

When I made it I also added 2 oz's apple cider vinegar, I also had some spice to make Italian sausage so I added 1 tsp. I also added some season salt that I made 1 tsp. It came out very good! This recepie has a lot of vegatables and I love it!
This was really good and so easy. I made it with what I had on hand and hubs had seconds (and a bite or two) before I could put it away. Will make this again.
Itâ€™s simple a bit bland the first time so Iâ€™m going to follow some tips from the reviews and Iâ€™m sure it will be even better!
Itâ€™s simple a bit bland the first time so Iâ€™m going to follow some tips from the reviews and Iâ€™m sure it will be even better!

Simple and yummy recipe! A family favourite! Weâ€™ve made it numerous times now and changed the recipe slightly. Our modifications: 1 or 2 jalapeÃ±os (extra kick), extra peppers (any colour, for extra nutrients and bulk), 1/2 can diced tomatoes, oregano, and crushed red pepper flakes
This was a hit! I used partially thawed, bone-in thighs. I also added red wine and tomato paste to the sauce as some others suggested. The chicken was perfect; not dry at all.
Definitely a favorite and so easy to make! Just put all of the ingredients in a slow cooker and wait for a tender, flavor-filled Italian favorite.
This is great!! Used red pepper instead of green, and added mushrooms, garlic and Italian seasoning. Served it on spaghetti squash!

I don't use my slow cooker as much as I should so I looked for a recipe with chicken and found this. I had to substitute boneless thighs (what I had) but no other changes. Easy and very flavorful. Served with penne.
I made it and it was awesome I put it over pasta I will be making this again
Easy to prepare. Chicken was very tender. I added crushed red pepper. We like a little heat added to the taste.

I made this because of the great time saver of not having to brown the meat first. I was sadly disappointed as although the meat was cooked it had a strange consistency. Also, I missed having more veggie additions...green/red peppers, mushrooms....I know I could have added them but when I try a new recipe I like to follow it to the letter.
I used chicken breast meat, which we found a bit dry. I would use boneless skinless thighs next time. I also added a bit of sugar to cut the acidity.

This is a 5 star recipe. Its so easy and the flavor is fantastic. I was drawn to this with the simplicity of adding 1 jar spaghetti sauce. Reading the reviews, everyone customizes to their liking and this is guaranteed to turn out. Because Im a vegetable lover, next time I plan to add more veges that other reviewers suggested including zucchini or carrots. I bought the giant boneless/skinless chicken breasts and 3 of them weighed 2.5#. It covered the bottom of my crock pot and I put all the ingredients over the top.
Unbelievably tender. And the leftovers were even more flavorful the next day. We loved this one.

I made this for the first time this week. I did substitute 3 stalks of sliced celery for one of the bell peppers, otherwise I followed the recipe. I do recommend reducing the oregano a bit, as I found it could become overwhelming of the other flavors. My girls enjoyed it, and I will be trying it again with less oregano!
It may need a little thickening, may want to add some tomato paste. I'm going to give it a shot next time.
Chicken turned out well. The sauce wasn't runny. It was missing something. I am not so good with the spices. Definitely not > 4
I have made it and loved it didn't have to change a thing. This one will go on my list of dinners to make again.
Meh... I usually make it from scratch and this really doesn't compare.
It was easy and tasty. Great recipe.

It was just OK. I wouldn't use thin pasta again though. 
I took the leftover chicken, shredded it added BBQ sauce and made sandwiches out of it .
Very simple to make but I used fresh ingredients as opposed to any jarred products it was a great ready to eat meal when I get home from work!
Chicken was overcooked. I will do it again for 2 hours less, but it was good aside from that.

I liked the amount of meat and veggies in this recipe but the seasonings from "Chicken Cacciatore in a Slow Cooker" so I combined them. I like a lot of seasoning. Here's what I added - 6 oz. tomato paste, another tablespoon of minced garlic plus 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 1/2 tsp dried oregano, 1/2 tsp basil, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes and 1 tsp Italian seasoning. Some of that was added to taste later because it needed more seasoning. Oh, I used a jar of mushrooms instead of fresh which I added for the last hour. I used 6 large chicken tenders. It was delicious. Next time I will use 8 chicken tenders and consider doubling the recipe - I like to freeze meal size portions. Also, my slow cooker is a little slow so after 3 1/2 hours on low, I turned it to high for another 1 1/2 hours so the veggies wouldn't be crunchy. It could have used another 1/2 hour on high. Next time I'm thinking about adding the uncooked spaghetti to the crock pot for the last 30 minutes for a 1 pot meal.
This is so easy and delicious. We also had sauce left over and put it over gnocchi. Also great.

This cacciatore is tasty if not spectacular. I was looking for an easy, chicken, slow-cooker recipe and this certainly fits that bill. I've made it twice with good results both times. Mine ended up a little watery, thinning down the spaghetti sauce more than I care for. My husband won't eat mushrooms so I left those out. That may make a difference in the amount of liquid, I don't know. But I'm no chef and it tasted good so I'm grateful for the recipe!
We loved this one! However, like another reviewer, I added I can of tomato paste, some oregano and basil. Lots of parmesan cheese when serving. Yummy. Will do this one again.
It was OK. The sauce was very runny and the breasts were almost dried. We had plenty of left overs. May try again adding some tomato paste to thicken things up.
Very good. As suggested by other reviewers, I used frozen chicken breasts and a can of tomato paste (next time I might use two cans) in addition to the pasta sauce.

We absolutely LOVE this recipe!! The only changes to the recipe I made was to pound the chicken a bit and add another jar of sauce( I used Classico Marinara & sweet pepper and garlic). We like more sauce and It stretched the dinner so we had leftovers during the week. It reheats perfectly!

Needs additional spices as others have pointed out but its a great base. In my house growing up, cacciatore was not made using jarred spaghetti sauce. Sauce was made using diced tomatoes, wine, etc. It is supposed to be on the thinner side, not thick like jarred sauce. Also, my dad used a more flavorful cut of chicken such as boneless skinless thighs. :-)

Really enjoyed this dish. Used thighs and reviewer kmilti's additional suggestions. Used sliced fresh portobello mushrooms that held up very well. Chicken was tender. Went with 7 hours closed, 1 hour open to thicken sauce.
This was delicious and so easy and quick to put together! The only change I made was to add tomato paste to thicken it. I used 2 small cans of paste.
the chicken breast got a little dried out next time i make this i will cut them into chunks but the flavor was good

I used 3 Chicken Breast (cubed) 1 jar of Bertolli Organic Olive Oil, Basil & Garlic, 1 can of Diced Tomatoes, 1 can of Mushrooms and a jar of artichokes, (like someone had suggested) I had it on high for about 4 hours and topped with Parmesan and Provolone cheeses until melted. Served over spaghetti. This turned out awesome. Thanks for sharing this fast and simple recipe.
mine needed lots of salt, more flavor, and the sauce ended up too runny as the vegetables leached their water over 7 hours.
Easy to make, and everyone enjoyed it. Will make it again.

Good basic recipe, but with some changes to spice it up a little was a real guest pleaser:
Used boneless/skinless thighs, used a combo of red/green peppers, added at least a tsp. of oregano and basil and a sprig of fresh rosemary, and doubled the garlic, transferred to a baking dish lined with a pound of cooked penne and topped with some shredded italian cheeses then baked for 15 min uncovered. My guests raved over it! The pasta soaks up the extra juice and makes it really flavorful.
Fantastic meal we enjoyed it very much. Thanks and keep on giving us great recipies.!!
added sun dried tomatoes and oven roasted peepers sliced up

One of the best cacciatore's I've made but, I did somewhat alter the recipe. I didn't have much time so I cut the chicken breasts into large strips and browned first, seasoning the chicken with salt, pepper, garlic, oregano and sriracha spices (for a bit of kick). Threw it into the slow cooker with the rest of the ingredients. Also added a small can of garlic and olive oil diced tomatoes and some additional oregano. Cooked for 4 hours. It was amazing.
I added 1/4 tsp of dried rosemary, 1 tbsp of olive oil and used Ragu Chunky Gardenstyle for the sauce. Other than that followed the recipe as is. Turned out really good!

I made this with chicken thighs, jar of Ragu marinara sauce, onions, pepper strips, minced garlic, mushrooms, seasonings. Put it over capellini pasta. I found the trick for me was to cook it on low for 4 hours. Meat was moist and tender, delicious.

I used a red pepper and chili tomato sauce for extra flavour. In the future I would add tomato paste to thicken and fresh basil for additional zest. As others have stated the sauce was a bit runny. Part of that could have been due to using frozen chicken breasts. Mine was cooked in 6 hours with fairly large breasts. Nine hours does seem excessive and I can only imagine how overdone the meat would have been.
I made this today and followed Kmilti's adjustments to the recipe. It was delish! Certainly a keeper!
Yes we will be making it again. We matched the chicken with fried rice in place of the white rice, and it turned out great.
It was easy to make, but the chicken came out dry and flavorless.
This was very easy to make and delicious. I will definitely be making this again and have passed along the recipe to another friend.
I made the recipe and it was delicious and easy!

It is quick and easy to prepare, but I think dark meat chicken would be better than breasts. The breasts were very tender, but still a bit dry. Also, despite using a premium spaghetti sauce, the flavor was lacking a little. I'd kick up the seasoning a little to give it more spicy kick. The chicken tended to rend out a lot of liquid, making the sauce runnier than it should have been. So perhaps a thicker marinara would be a better starter.
Will add additional spices.
My family absolutely loved this recipe! I did add an extra jar of sauce because we tend to like our stuff a little more saucey!!! I will definitely be making this recipe again !!!
It was flavorless. Will not make it again.
Served with brown rice as we need to cut carbs. Needed salt to taste. One of our favorites!
It was good but I don't think picky grandchildren would agree. I will fix it again for adult family
This recipe was delicious!! I did not use mushrooms due to allergies but who needs them. It was perfect!!

I made the recipe as listed, except I did use frozen chicken breasts as several reviews suggested, and it was a good idea. The chicken stayed intact and tasty. I will make this again, but I will add some more seasoning to the dish like oregano, basil, maybe rosemary, etc. The family liked it too. It was very easy which is always a good thing!
This was delicious!!! I will be making it again.
Great recipe! I too added oregano, peppers, basil, etc definitely will make again!
So easy and so delicious!

Love this recipe! IT was so good and easy! I love the pasta sauce rather then tomatoes from a can... better flavor & makes it thicker ..My chicken was not frozen when I put it in. Cooking slow and low... the chicken was tender!!!! I also added the fresh mushrooms & peppers in about 1 hours prior to cooking so they where not mushy!I added paprika, Mrs Dash Garlic & herbs, fresh parsley and basil. So yummy will make again!
It was very good. I will make it again. The family said it wasnt quite juicy enough, but they liked it
Excellent! I'll make this super easy dish again
Followed the recipe exactly without the mushrooms (we are not mushroom people). Turned out delicious, chicken moist, fell apart and full of flavor!
